 Default idle timeout in milliseconds. (One minute).

 Default maximum number of threads the thread pool contains. (25).

 Default minimum number of threads the thread pool contains. (0).
const bool DefaultStartSuspended = false
 The default is to work on work items as soon as they arrive and not to wait for the start.
const ThreadPriority DefaultThreadPriority = ThreadPriority.Normal
 The default thread priority.
const bool DefaultUseCallerCallContext = false
 Indicate to copy the security context of the caller and then use it in the call. (false).
const bool DefaultUseCallerHttpContext = false
 Indicate to copy the HTTP context of the caller and then use it in the call. (false).

 The default work item priority.

static bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll ( IWorkItemResult[]  workItemResults  )  [static]

Wait for all work items to complete.

Parameters:
workItemResults Array of work item result objects
Returns:
true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.
static bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll ( IWorkItemResult[]  workItemResults,
TimeSpan  timeout,
bool  exitContext 
) [static]

Wait for all work items to complete.

Parameters:
workItemResults Array of work item result objects
timeout The number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
exitContext true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
Returns:
true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.
static bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll ( IWorkItemResult[]  workItemResults,
int  millisecondsTimeout,
bool  exitContext 
) [static]

Wait for all work items to complete.

Parameters:
workItemResults Array of work item result objects
millisecondsTimeout The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
exitContext true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
Returns:
true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.
static bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll ( IWorkItemResult[]  workItemResults,
int  millisecondsTimeout,
bool  exitContext,
WaitHandle  cancelWaitHandle 
) [static]

Wait for all work items to complete.

Parameters:
workItemResults Array of work item result objects
millisecondsTimeout The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
exitContext true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
cancelWaitHandle A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
Returns:
true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.

TimeSpan  timeout,
bool  exitContext,

cancelWaitHandle A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
Returns:
true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.
static int Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAny ( IWorkItemResult[]  workItemResults,
int  millisecondsTimeout,
bool  exitContext,
WaitHandle  cancelWaitHandle 
) [static]

Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout.

Parameters:
workItemResults Array of work item result objects
millisecondsTimeout The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
exitContext true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
cancelWaitHandle A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
Returns:
The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.
static int Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAny ( IWorkItemResult[]  workItemResults,
TimeSpan  timeout,
bool  exitContext 
) [static]

timeout The number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
exitContext true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
Returns:
The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.

Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout.

Parameters:
workItemResults Array of work item result objects
Returns:
The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if any of the work items has been canceled.
static int Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAny ( IWorkItemResult[]  workItemResults,
TimeSpan  timeout,
bool  exitContext,
WaitHandle  cancelWaitHandle 
) [static]

Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout.

Parameters:
workItemResults Array of work item result objects
timeout The number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
exitContext true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
cancelWaitHandle A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
Returns:
The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.

Member Data Documentation

const CallToPostExecute Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultCallToPostExecute = CallToPostExecute.Always

The default option to run the post execute.

const bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultDisposeOfStateObjects = false

Indicate to dispose of the state objects if they support the IDispose interface. (false).

const int Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultIdleTimeout = 60*1000

Default idle timeout in milliseconds. (One minute).

const int Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultMaxWorkerThreads = 25

Default maximum number of threads the thread pool contains. (25).

const int Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultMinWorkerThreads = 0

Default minimum number of threads the thread pool contains. (0).

readonly string Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultPerformanceCounterInstanceName [static]

The default is not to use the performance counters.

readonly PostExecuteWorkItemCallback Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultPostExecuteWorkItemCallback [static]

The default post execute method to run. When null it means not to call it.

const bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultStartSuspended = false

The default is to work on work items as soon as they arrive and not to wait for the start.

const ThreadPriority Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultThreadPriority = ThreadPriority.Normal

The default thread priority.

const bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultUseCallerCallContext = false

Indicate to copy the security context of the caller and then use it in the call. (false).

const bool Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultUseCallerHttpContext = false

Indicate to copy the HTTP context of the caller and then use it in the call. (false).

const WorkItemPriority Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultWorkItemPriority = WorkItemPriority.Normal

The default work item priority.

int Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.ActiveThreads [get]
